snippet: Missouri Senator Claire McCaskill won a second term on Tuesday, beating Representative Todd Akin in a remarkable turnaround for a lawmaker once believed to be the Senate’s most vulnerable Democratic incumbent.
abstract: Missouri Sen Claire McCaskill wins second term, fending off challenge from Rep Todd Akin in remarkable turnover for lawmaker once believed to be Senate's most vulnerable Democratic incumbent; Akin's campaign entered tailspin after an abortion-related remark in which he referred to the concept of 'legitimate rape.'
lead_paragraph: Missouri Senator Claire McCaskill won a second term on Tuesday, beating Representative Todd Akin in a remarkable turnaround for a lawmaker once believed to be the Senate’s most vulnerable Democratic incumbent.

headline.main: Turnaround in Missouri as Incumbent Keeps Seat
headline.print_headline: Turnaround In Missouri As Incumbent Keeps Seat
